Package javelin.controller.action

Class ActionCost

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.controller.action.ActionCost
  • public class ActionCost
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for more idyommatic access to different types of Combatant.ap costs. TODO this was introduced during the development of 1.7 and as such most of the code doesn' use it even though it uses the same assumptions underlined here. It would be nice to look at all the methods using Combatant.ap and convert them into this format though.
    Author:
    alex

    • Field Detail

      • FULL

        public static final float FULL
        A full-round action, equal to a full action point (1ap). Example: using an entire AttackSequence (even though this is done non-linearly in the game - but eventually reaching 1ap after all attacks are made).
        See Also:
        CurrentAttack, Constant Field Values

      • PARTIAL

        public static final float PARTIAL
        You can make both a STANDARD and a MOVE action per turn. It makes sense then that each would take half the action points of a FULL action.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STANDARD

        public static final float STANDARD
        Standard action. Example: making a single Attack from an AttackSequence (usually using the first one, which is the best, by convention) - note though that this is only done on special cases such as Charge or Strikes - normal attacks are handled by CurrentAttack and as such as considered a FULL action that is broken into smaller actions for each attack in the sequence.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MOVE

        public static final float MOVE
        Move-equivalent action. Example: walking as many feet as an unit's speed allows.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SWIFT

        public static final float SWIFT
        Described as very fast, as it can be done only once per turn without affecting anything else. Making it half of a STANDARD action seems to satifsty this, as more than one use per turn would result in the same amount as an actual PARTIAL action.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FIVEFOOTSTEP

        public static final float FIVEFOOTSTEP
        Just like a SWIFT action, this is considered something you can only do once per turn. Hence, it has the same value. Note that this has an edge case of making using both a FIVEFOOTSTEP and a SWIFT action would result in the same AP cost of a STANDARD action, while it should, ideally, be treated as a free-action (0ap). This would be the same as using 2 SWIFT action in a single turn. That's not very worrying or game breaking though (especially considering SWIFT actions are pretty rare - but it could be improved upon with some math. TODO
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public ActionCost()
